title: How to Edit Captions on Instagram

steps.headline: Open Instagram on your phone or tablet.
steps.description: It’s the purple, pink, orange, and yellow icon with a white camera. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer (on an Android).

steps.headline: Tap the profile icon.
steps.description: It’s the outline of a person at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This displays all of the photos and videos you’ve posted.

steps.headline: Open the post you want to edit.
steps.description: If you’re viewing your posts as a grid, tap the photo or video preview to open it. Otherwise, simply scroll down until you’ve found the post with the caption you want to edit.

steps.headline: Tap ⋯ (iPhone/iPad) or  ⁝ (Android).
steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the photo or video. A menu will expand.

steps.headline: Tap Edit.
steps.description: This opens your caption in editing mode.

steps.headline: Edit your caption to your liking.
steps.description: You can backspace over what you’ve already written or add more as needed.

steps.headline: Edit other details of your post (optional).
steps.description: To add a location, tap Add Location  at the top of the photo, then make your selection. To edit an existing location, tap it, then tap Change Location  to select a new one (or Remove Location to delete it completely). To edit a tag on a photo or video, tap the tag, then tap the X  to remove it. To add a tag, tap Tag People , tap the person or object on the photo, then select the user. To edit the Alt Text (the optional post descriptions for sight-impaired Instagram users), tap Edit Alt Text  at the bottom-right corner of the photo, edit your descriptions as needed, then tap Done  at the top-right corner.

steps.headline: Tap Done to save your changes.
steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. Your caption (and any other details you’ve edited) will get published.

If you’re viewing your posts as a grid, tap the photo or video preview to open it. Otherwise, simply scroll down until you’ve found the post with the caption you want to edit. To add a location, tap Add Location  at the top of the photo, then make your selection. To edit an existing location, tap it, then tap Change Location  to select a new one (or Remove Location to delete it completely). To edit a tag on a photo or video, tap the tag, then tap the X  to remove it. To add a tag, tap Tag People , tap the person or object on the photo, then select the user. To edit the Alt Text (the optional post descriptions for sight-impaired Instagram users), tap Edit Alt Text  at the bottom-right corner of the photo, edit your descriptions as needed, then tap Done  at the top-right corner. Tap Done to save your changes. It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. Your caption (and any other details you’ve edited) will get published.
